definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

sentences.english: Captain Aoyagi, the company commander, was killed while he directed the defense.
sentences.chinese: 连队指挥官，青柳上尉，在直接参加防御战时阵亡。

sentences.english: He was part of the battalion's planning team, but he hoped to finish the tour as a front-line company commander.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名营级指挥官，但他想要去前线亲自指挥作战。

sentences.english: Following Afghan tradition, local commanders are building independent fiefs that they will be reluctant to relinquish.
sentences.chinese: 按照阿富汗的传统，当地的指挥官都愿意自立王国。

sentences.english: You screwed up, you didn't know whether to be more scared of the CO or John.
sentences.chinese: 当你搞砸了的时候，你不知道该更怕指挥官还是约翰。

sentences.english: We was later fired from his command by President Truman.
sentences.chinese: 杜鲁门后来撤销了他的指挥官职务。

sentences.english: The forums let all deployed commanders communicate and share knowledge, Barclay said.
sentences.chinese: 在该论坛让所有部署指挥官沟通和分享知识。

sentences.english: After the cessation of conflict between the two countries conducted negotiations with the military front-line commanders.
sentences.chinese: 冲突停止后，两国军方前线指挥官进行了谈判。

sentences.english: Most of these destroyer commanders are qualified naval pilots.
sentences.chinese: 这些驱逐舰指挥官大多数是合格的海军飞行员。

sentences.english: Commanders wearing face masks roamed the streets, issuing orders through walkie-talkies.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官们带着面具漫步街头，通过对讲机发出命令。

sentences.english: Lt Col Mayele was arrested in Walikale in eastern Congo.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官马耶勒在刚果东部的瓦利卡尔被捕。

sentences.english: The commander decide to make an airstrike on the enemy's supply line.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官决定空袭敌人的补给线。

sentences.english: The commander was able to rally the fleeing troops.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官能够重整其溃散的部队。

sentences.english: The UEF ACU can be upgraded with an artillery gun which is hidden in his chest.
sentences.chinese: UEF的指挥官可以升级隐藏在胸部内的火炮。

sentences.english: Tian Jing is a feisty enough female commander.
sentences.chinese: 景甜是个精力足够充沛的女指挥官。

sentences.english: The commander said al-Saadi had called back early Wednesday morning, but that he had missed the call.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说萨迪回叫早星期三早晨，但他错过了电话。

sentences.english: In 1997, Budde was made Commander of the Multinational Brigade Centre in Sarajevo.
sentences.chinese: 1997年他成为萨拉热窝多国旅中心的指挥官。

definition: junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
